properties.areaDesc: Mono; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Northern Washoe County; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California; Greater Lake Tahoe Area
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 1:46PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* Sunday Afternoon-Monday Morning: More wind and another round of
light snow showers. Typical wind impacts focused in mountains
and along Highway 395. Light snow showers affecting Sierra and
northeast California passes.

* Monday Evening-Tuesday: A lot of wind and heavier snow.
Widespread wind impacts including potential for localized
damage, power outages in wind prone areas along Highway 395.
Severe turbulence can be expected. Period of heavy snow causing
disruptions for Sierra travel. Brief snow ahead of Tuesday
morning commute in western Nevada cities.

* Wednesday Evening-Thursday: A lot of snow and probably more
wind. Strongest storm in the sequence and also colder leading to
increased heavy snow and whiteout potential in the Sierra and
northeast California. Strong wind impacts with a period of snow
for western Nevada cities. Tough commute Thursday morning. This
scenario would be quite disruptive for travel and commutes, has
the capability to be the largest storm of the winter season
thus far.

* Anyone with road or air travel plans over the coming week should
keep a close eye on the forecast. Disruptions and delays are a
good bet from these storms. For road condition information
check with NDOT or Caltrans or your favorite mapping app.

NWSheadline: Disruptive Winter Storms This Coming Week
